title: Comparatives and Superlatives Adjectives Quiz
purpose: To help learners understand and practice the correct usage of comparative and superlative adjectives in English, including special cases.

questions.question: Choose the correct comparative form: 'My new car is _______ (fast) than my old one.'
questions.explanation: 'Fast' is a one-syllable adjective, so we add '-er' for the comparative form.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'She is the _______ (tall) person in her family.'
questions.explanation: 'Tall' is a one-syllable adjective, so we add '-est' for the superlative form.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the comparative form correctly?
choices: This book is gooder than that one.
This book is more good than that one.
This book is better than that one.
This book is the best than that one.
questions.explanation: 'Good' is an irregular adjective; its comparative form is 'better'.

questions.question: Identify the correct superlative form: 'He is the _______ (bad) singer I've ever heard.'
questions.explanation: 'Bad' is an irregular adjective; its superlative form is 'worst'.

questions.question: Choose the correct option: 'This exercise is _______ (difficult) than the last one.'
questions.explanation: For adjectives with two or more syllables (like 'difficult'), we use 'more' for the comparative form.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Mount Everest is the _______ (high) mountain in the world.'
questions.explanation: 'High' is a one-syllable adjective, so we add '-est' for the superlative form.

questions.question: Which of the following is correct?
choices: She is prettyer than her sister.
She is prettier than her sister.
She is more pretty than her sister.
She is most pretty than her sister.
questions.explanation: For adjectives ending in '-y' (like 'pretty'), we change 'y' to 'i' and add '-er' for the comparative form.

questions.question: The superlative form of 'friendly' is:
questions.explanation: 'Friendly' ends in '-y', so we change 'y' to 'i' and add '-est' for the superlative form.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'This is the _______ (small) car I could find.'
questions.explanation: 'Small' is a one-syllable adjective, so we add '-est' for the superlative form.

questions.question: Choose the best option: 'He is _______ (happy) now than he was yesterday.'
questions.explanation: 'Happy' ends in '-y', so we change 'y' to 'i' and add '-er' for the comparative form.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the superlative form correctly?
choices: This is the more interesting book.
This is the most interesting book.
questions.explanation: 'Interesting' is a long adjective, so we use 'most' for the superlative form.

questions.question: Identify the correct comparative form: 'My new phone is _______ (expensive) than my old one.'
questions.explanation: 'Expensive' is a long adjective, so we use 'more' for the comparative form.

questions.question: The comparative form of 'far' is:
questions.explanation: 'Far' is an irregular adjective; its comparative form can be 'further' or 'farther'.

questions.question: The superlative form of 'far' is:
questions.explanation: 'Far' is an irregular adjective; its superlative form can be 'furthest' or 'farthest'.

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
choices: He runs faster than anyone else.
He runs more fast than anyone else.
He runs the fastest than anyone else.
He runs most fast than anyone else.
questions.explanation: 'Fast' is a one-syllable adjective, so we add '-er' for the comparative form. 'Anyone else' implies comparison.
